trans-unit.target: TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_000<tab>I have nothing to say to outsiders.
TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_010<tab>Yes? Come to inquire about najool, have you?
TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_020<tab>I am but a humble grove worker. Though najool─Ja Tiika bananas, as you call them─may have an unusual appearance, they are actually quite sweet.

TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_021<tab>I have proposed various uses for the glowing peels, such as employing them to cure animal skins, or adding them to medicines. Unfortunately, my ideas are not very popular...
TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_030<tab>This is Golmajiik Grove, where we cultivate najool. As you can see, it is one of the brighter, more open locations in Mamook.

TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_031<tab>The fruit is primarily consumed by our own people, but the leaves...w-well, outsiders are known to use them as well. I'm afraid I can say no more on the matter. Trade secrets, and all.

TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_040<tab>To think we could grow other crops here... Nevertheless, I intend to remain a najool farmer, as I always have. They are a precious part of our culture, after all.

TEXT_REGYOK6GOLMAJIIKGROVE_00878_HAPOLLJA_000_050<tab>Blessed siblings no longer stand in the highest position of power. I know this, and yet the truth has not fully sunk in. But perhaps this forest will succeed in changing after all...
